cooking_method:
1. Cut the chicken into small cubes and marinate in soy sauce and rice vinegar for 20 minutes.
2. Fry the chicken in a wok until golden brown.
3. Add dried chili pepper and peanuts and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
4. Serve with steamed rice.

1. Cut the tofu into small cubes and set aside.
2. Brown the ground pork in a wok, then add chopped scallions and garlic.
3. Stir in doubanjiang and cook until fragrant.
4. Add the tofu and some water, and simmer for 5-10 minutes.
5. Serve with steamed rice.

1. Soak the dried shiitake mushrooms in hot water for 10-15 minutes, then slice them thinly.
2. Bring the chicken broth to a boil, then add the sliced mushrooms, tofu, and bamboo shoots.
3. Beat the eggs in a bowl, then slowly pour them into the soup while stirring.
4. Season with vinegar, soy sauce, and white pepper.
5. Serve hot.

1. Mix the flour, salt, and water in a bowl to make a dough.
2. Chop the scallions finely and mix them into the dough.
3. Roll the dough into thin pancakes.
4. Fry the pancakes in a pan with some vegetable oil until golden brown.
5. Serve hot.

1. Slice the pork tenderloin thinly and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch.
2. Stir-fry the pork in a wok until browned, then add sliced shiitake mushrooms and bamboo shoots.
3. Beat the eggs in a bowl, then pour them into the wok and stir-fry until cooked.
4. Add hoisin sauce and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
5. Serve with Mandarin pancakes or steamed rice.

1. Mix cornstarch with water to make a slurry.
2. Bring the chicken broth to a boil, then add the cornstarch slurry and stir.
3. Beat the eggs in a bowl, then pour them into the soup while stirring.
4. Season with soy sauce and sesame oil.
5. Serve hot.

1. Slice the flank steak thinly and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch.
2. Cut the broccoli into bite-sized pieces.
3. Stir-fry the beef in a wok until browned, then set aside.
4. Stir-fry the garlic and broccoli until tender.
5. Add the beef back to the wok and stir in oyster sauce.
6. Serve with steamed rice.

1. Clean and devein the shrimp, then pat dry with paper towels.
2. Coat the shrimp with cornstarch and fry until crispy.
3. Toast the walnuts in a pan.
4. Mix mayonnaise, honey, and lemon juice in a bowl to make the sauce.
5. Combine the shrimp and walnuts with the sauce.
6. Serve with steamed broccoli and rice.

1. Cut the chicken into small pieces and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch.
2. Heat oil in a wok and stir-fry the chicken until cooked.
3. Remove the chicken from the wok and set aside.
4. Stir-fry dried red chili peppers, scallions, and roasted peanuts in the wok for a few minutes.
5. Add the chicken back to the wok and stir-fry for another minute.
6. Serve with steamed rice.

1. Soak dried wood ear mushrooms in hot water until they soften, then slice thinly.
2. Cut tofu and bamboo shoots into small pieces.
3. Bring chicken broth to a boil, then add the mushrooms, tofu, and bamboo shoots.
4. Season with soy sauce, vinegar, and white pepper.
5. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water to make a slurry.
6. Slowly pour the slurry into the soup, stirring continuously, until the soup thickens.
7. Add a beaten egg and stir the soup.
8. Serve hot.

recipe_name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
cooking_method:
1. Clean and gut the whole fish, then pat dry with paper towels.
2. Slice ginger and scallions into thin strips.
3. Place the fish on a plate and spread ginger and scallions on top of the fish.
4. Season the fish with soy sauce and sesame oil.
5. Steam the fish for about 10-15 minutes, depending on the size of the fish.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
2. Brown the ground pork in a pan, then add minced garlic and Sichuan peppercorn.
3. Add chili oil and stir-fry for a few minutes.
4. Mix the cooked noodles with the pork sauce.
5. Serve hot, garnished with chopped scallions and sesame seeds.

1. Cut the tofu into small cubes and set aside.
2. Brown the ground pork in a pan, then add minced garlic and Sichuan peppercorn.
3. Add chili bean paste and doubanjiang, stir-fry for a few minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let simmer for a few minutes.
5. Add the tofu cubes and gently stir to combine.
6. Let the tofu cook in the sauce for a few minutes.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Mix flour, salt, and water to form a dough.
2. Knead the dough until it is smooth, then cover and let rest for 30 minutes.
3. Roll out the dough into a thin sheet, then brush with sesame oil.
4. Sprinkle chopped scallions on top of the oiled dough.
5. Roll up the dough, then twist it into a spiral shape.
6. Flatten the spiral shape into a pancake.
7. Fry the pancake in a pan until golden brown on both sides.
8. Serve hot.

1. Clean and devein the shrimp, then pat dry with paper towels.
2. Heat oil in a wok, then stir-fry minced garlic, ginger, and chili peppers until fragrant.
3. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until they turn pink.
4. Season with Sichuan peppercorn and soy sauce.
5. Stir-fry for another minute.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Cut broccoli and carrots into bite-sized pieces, and slice baby corn in half.
2. Blanch the broccoli and carrots in boiling water for a few minutes, then drain and set aside.
3. Heat oil in a wok, then stir-fry minced garlic until fragrant.
4. Add baby corn and snow peas, and stir-fry for a few minutes.
5. Add the blanched broccoli and carrots, and stir-fry for another minute.
6. Season with soy sauce and sesame oil.

recipe_name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallion
cooking_method:
1. Clean the fish and pat dry with paper towels.
2. Cut a few slits on both sides of the fish.
3. Slice ginger and scallions and place them on top of the fish.
4. Steam the fish for about 8-10 minutes or until cooked through.
5. In a small pan, heat soy sauce and sesame oil until it starts to bubble.
6. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the fish.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Soak dried mushrooms in hot water for 20 minutes.
2. Cut tofu, bamboo shoots, and carrots into small cubes.
3. Drain the mushrooms and slice them.
4. In a pot, bring chicken broth to a boil, then add the tofu, bamboo shoots, carrots, and mushrooms.
5. Add vinegar, soy sauce, and chili oil to the pot.
6. In a small bowl, whisk cornstarch and water, then slowly pour the mixture into the soup, stirring constantly.
7. Let the soup simmer for a few minutes, then season with salt and white pepper.
8. Serve hot.

1. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a small bowl, whisk soy sauce, rice vinegar, and cornstarch to make a marinade.
3. Marinate the chicken for 15 minutes.
4. Heat oil in a wok, then stir-fry minced garlic and ginger until fragrant.
5. Add dried chili peppers and Sichuan peppercorn, stir-fry for a few seconds.
6. Add the chicken and stir-fry until it is cooked through.
7. Add chopped green onions and peanuts, stir-fry for another minute.
8. Season with soy sauce and sugar.
9. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. In a pan, scramble eggs until fully cooked, then set aside.
2. In the same pan, stir-fry peas, carrots, and chopped green onions until softened.
3. Add cooked rice to the pan, and stir-fry.

1. Cut tofu into small cubes.
2. Heat oil in a wok, then stir-fry ground pork until browned.
3. Add minced garlic, ginger, and doubanjiang to the wok, stir-fry until fragrant.
4. Add tofu to the wok, stir-fry for a few minutes.
5. Add water or broth to the wok, and bring it to a boil.
6. Reduce the heat, and let it simmer for a few minutes.
7. Add cornstarch slurry to the wok, stir until the sauce thickens.
8. Season with soy sauce, sugar, and Sichuan peppercorn.
9. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. In a pan, scramble eggs until fully cooked, then set aside.
2. In the same pan, stir-fry shrimp until they turn pink, then set aside.
3. In the same pan, stir-fry peas and carrots until softened.
4. Add cooked rice to the pan, and stir-fry for a few minutes.
5. Add shrimp and scrambled eggs to the pan, stir-fry until everything is heated through.
6. Season with salt and white pepper.
7. Serve hot.

1. Cut beef into thin slices.
2. Cut broccoli into florets.
3. Heat oil in a wok, then stir-fry beef until browned.
4. Add minced garlic and ginger to the wok, stir-fry until fragrant.
5. Add broccoli to the wok, stir-fry for a few minutes.
6. Add water.

1. In a pan, scramble eggs until fully cooked, then set aside.
2. In the same pan, stir-fry peas, carrots, and chopped green onions until softened.
3. Add cooked rice to the pan, and stir-fry.
